messageCorrelations.messagePreview: I mean I've been paying for it for three months, I just think it's fair

annotation.label: Mild defensiveness trigger
annotation.text: Your HR jumped 4 bpm when Kevin raised the fairness point, and stress climbed from 30 to 36. HRV dropped from 43ms to 41ms - a modest but real shift. This was not a major threat response, but your body registered the implicit accusation of unfairness. Money conversations activate a specific kind of low-grade defensiveness in your system - not fight-or-flight, but a persistent vigilance that keeps your readings elevated.

messageCorrelations.messagePreview: I thought we said we'd split it starting in January

annotation.label: Clarification raises stress
annotation.text: Your HR rose from 80 to 82 and stress peaked at 45 when you tried to clarify your position - the highest readings of the conversation. HRV dipped to 38ms, a 21% drop from your baseline of 48ms. Attempting to correct a perceived misunderstanding activated your system more than Kevin's original statement did. Your body treats the act of defending yourself as more stressful than being challenged.

overallInsight: This 9-minute conversation about a shared expense produced moderate but sustained stress activation. Your HR climbed steadily from a 65 bpm baseline to a peak of 82 bpm - a 26% increase - and HRV dropped from 48ms to 38ms. Stress rose from 20 to a peak of 45. The topic itself was minor (splitting a subscription), but the friction around perceived fairness kept your nervous system in a state of low-grade vigilance throughout. The most notable pattern was that your own clarification attempt at 6:00 produced the highest stress reading of 45, surpassing your response to Kevin's initial comment at 3:00 (stress 36). This suggests that the act of defending your position is more physiologically activating for you than receiving the challenge. The conversation ended with HR still at 72 and stress at 29 - elevated but heading toward baseline, with full recovery taking about 4 minutes after the call ended.
